name: Counting the sum of the numbers in the array is interrupted when encountering a three-digit number
instruction:
Write a function `stopAt3DigitNum` that takes one parameter, an array of numbers.

The function returns the sum of all the numbers in the array.

If there is a positive three-digit number in the array, the summation stops and the current sum is returned.

An example of running the function:
```javascript
stopAt3DigitNum([1, 12, 35, 57, 123, 36, 3, 4, 2345]) // 1 + 12 + 35 + 57 = 105
stopAt3DigitNum([1, 35, -123, 36, 3, 4]) // 1 + 35 + (-123) + 36 + 3 + 4 = -44
stopAt3DigitNum([1, 35, 3, 4]) // 1 + 35 + 3 + 4 = 43
```
